1.str2: First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Supplication, prayer, entreaty. From deomai; a petition.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
From entugchano; an interview, i.e. supplication.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.

1.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
1.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

2.str2: Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Superiority, excellence, preeminence, authority. From huperecho; prominence, i.e. superiority.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

2.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
2.str2: (either trans. or intrans.), I spend time, pass time, live. From dia and ago; to pass time or life.
Quiet, tranquil. Perhaps by transposition from eremos; tranquil.
A prolonged form of a compound probably of a derivative of the base of hedraios and perhaps echo; properly, keeping one's seat, i.e. still.
A primary word; life, i.e. the present state of existence; by implication, the means of livelihood.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
Dignity, honor, gravity, seriousness. From semnos; venerableness, i.e. Probity.

3.str2: Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
Worthy to be received (welcomed), acceptable, welcome, pleasant. From apodechomai; accepted, i.e. Agreeable.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.

4.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.

5.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From mesos; a go-between, i.e. an internunciator, or a reconciler.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

6.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

6.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
6.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

6.parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

6.str2: A ransom. From anti and lutron; a redemption-price.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

7.str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

7.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
7.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

7.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
7.str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
A herald, preacher, proclaimer. From kerusso; a herald, i.e. Of divine truth.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
7.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
7.str2: To deceive, lie, speak falsely. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood.

8.str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

8.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
8.str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.

8.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
8.str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.

8.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
8.str2: To raise, lift up. From epi and airo; to raise up.
Holy, pious, godly, beloved of God. Of uncertain affinity; properly, right, i.e. Hallowed.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.
From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.
From dialogizomai; discussion, i.e. consideration, or debate.

9.str2: In like manner, likewise, just so. From hos and an adverb from autos; as thus, i.e. In the same way.
And, even, also, namely.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
To put into order; I decorate, deck, adorn. From kosmos; to put in proper order, i.e. Decorate; specially, to snuff.

9.parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
9.str2: Himself, herself, itself.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Orderly, virtuous, decent, modest, well-ordered. From kosmos; orderly, i.e. Decorous.
Garb, clothing, dress, attire. From katastello; a deposit, i.e. costume.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Shame, modesty. Perhaps from a and eido; bashfulness, i.e., modesty or awe.
And, even, also, namely.
Soundness of mind, sanity; self-control, sobriety. From sophron; soundness of mind, i.e. sanity or self-control.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Braided hair, anything interwoven. From pleko; a plait.
And, even, also, namely.
A piece of gold, golden ornament. Diminutive of chrusos; a golden article, i.e. Gold plating, ornament, or coin.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A pearl. From margaros; a pearl.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Very costly, very precious, of great value. From polus and telos; extremely expensive.
A collective word: raiment, clothing. From himatizo; clothing.

10.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

10.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
10.str2: It becomes, is fitting to, is right. Apparently a primary verb; to tower up, i.e. to be suitable or proper.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

10.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Plural
10.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.
Reverence for God, fear of God, godliness, piety. From theosebes; devoutness, i.e. Piety.

11.str2: A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

11.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Quietness, stillness, silence. Feminine of hesuchios; stillness, i.e. Desistance from bustle or language.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Subjection, submission, obedience. From hupotasso; subordination.

12.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
12.str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
To domineer, govern, have mastery over. From a compound of autos and an obsolete hentes; to act of oneself, i.e. dominate.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Quietness, stillness, silence. Feminine of hesuchios; stillness, i.e. Desistance from bustle or language.

13.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Adam, the first man, the first parent of the human race. Of Hebrew origin; Adam, the first man; typically man.

13.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
13.str2: To form, mould, as a potter his clay. A primary verb; to mould, i.e. Shape or fabricate.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
A particle of succession, then, moreover.
Eve, the first woman; wife of first man Adam. Of Hebrew origin; Eua, the first woman.

14.str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Adam, the first man, the first parent of the human race. Of Hebrew origin; Adam, the first man; typically man.

14.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
14.str2: To deceive, cheat, lead into error. Of uncertain derivation; to cheat, i.e. Delude.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

14.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
14.str2: To deceive thoroughly. From ek and apatao; to seduce wholly.

14.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
14.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A transgression, overstepping, deviation. From parabaino; violation.

15.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
15.str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Child bearing, the rearing of a family. From the same as teknogoneo; childbirth, i.e. maternity.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
15.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
From hagiazo; properly, purification, i.e. purity; concretely a purifier.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Soundness of mind, sanity; self-control, sobriety. From sophron; soundness of mind, i.e. sanity or self-control.
